page.title: 13Origins of Irvine Marymass
page.content: During the{Middle Ages,}the people who lived in Irvine worked for their feudal lord and the only time off work was for religious festivals or{Holy {Days.}The Holy Days in Irvine were in the third week in August each year. On the Saturday of that week, everyone went to church to say a{mass}to the Virgin Mary. In the afternoon everyone went to the town common{(Irvine Moor)} for an afternoon of sport- a{Medieval {Fair.}This was the start of our {Marymass Festival}which is still held on the Saturday following the third Monday in August each year.
